eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PlatformerCharacterAnimator
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Change animations and horizontal flipping of a platformer character automatically.
description: Automatically change the animations and horizontal flipping of a platformer character based on movement and interaction with platform objects.
The platformer example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change animations and horizontal flipping of a platformer character automatically.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PlatformerCharacterAnimator

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangleMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern with easing functions from the Tween extension.
It can be used for:
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Moving along the border of another object (inside, center, outside)
The platformer example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer)).
This game shows how to make objects move around the border of another object ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://moving-saw-platformer)).
This example can be used to test different settings ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://rectangular-movement)).

eventsFunctions.description: Distance from an object to the closest edge of a second object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Distance from an object to the closest edge of a second object
eventsFunctions.name: DistanceToClosestEdge
eventsFunctions.sentence: Distance from _PARAM1_ to the closest edge of _PARAM2_

events.comment: If point is inside rectangle, just use min distance

parameters:
min(
min(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY() - CenterObject.BoundingBoxTop(), 
CenterObject.BoundingBoxBottom() - MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY()),
min(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX() - CenterObject.BoundingBoxLeft(), 
CenterObject.BoundingBoxRight() - MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX())
)

events.comment: If point is outside rectangle, find distance to clamped position on rectangle

parameters:
DistanceBetweenPositions(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX(),
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY(),
clamp(MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxLeft(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxRight()),
clamp(MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxTop(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxBottom())
)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...
description: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers).
It gives access to:
- button presses
- axis positions and force
- trigger pressure
- configurable deadzone
- vibration
- automatic mappers for platformer characters and top-down movement
The Bomberman-like example handles 4 players with gamepads ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://goose-bomberman)).
